titles.title: A bill to designate a United States courthouse located in Fresno, California, as the "Robert E. Coyle United States Courthouse".

action.text: Sponsor introductory remarks on measure. (CR S2811-2812)
Read twice and referred to the Committee on Environment and Public Works.

calendar.text: Committee on Environment and Public Works. Ordered to be reported without amendment favorably.

action.text: Committee on Environment and Public Works. Reported by Senator Boxer without amendment. Without written report.

calendar.text: Placed on Senate Legislative Calendar under General Orders. Calendar No. 106.

vote.text: Passed Senate without amendment by Unanimous Consent.

action.text: Message on Senate action sent to the House.
Referred to the House Committee on Transportation and Infrastructure.
Referred to the Subcommittee on Economic Development, Public Buildings and Emergency Management.
Ms. Norton moved to suspend the rules and pass the bill.
Considered under suspension of the rules.
DEBATE - The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate on S. 801.

vote.text: On motion to suspend the rules and pass the bill Agreed to by voice vote.

bill.summary: 7/5/2007--Public Law. (This measure has not been amended since it was introduced. The summary of that version is repeated here.) Designates the U.S. courthouse bordered by O Street, P Street, Tulare Street, and Capitol Street in Fresno, California, as the "Robert E. Coyle United States Courthouse."
